name: Canton Paradise 樂天小香港 at ARC

reviews.text:
First time at this outlet, and it’s just as good as the others! Their dim sum is always fresh, well-made, and packed with flavor—comforting bites that make you want to come back for more.

The staff are warm, polite, and attentive, adding to the pleasant dining experience. If you’re craving quality Cantonese fare in a relaxed setting, this is definitely the spot!

Nice food. We went here for lunch. Ordered thei sharing menu: Steamed Flounder in Hong Kong Style, Stir-fried Gong Bao Chicken Fillet, Braised Firm Tofu with Assorted Mushrooms, Stif-fried Spinach with Garlic.
Steamed Fish was fresh and then sauce was nice. Gong Bao Chicken was good and tasty, and the meat was juicy and not dry. Braised Tofu was nice too. The Garlic Spinach (forgot to take picture) was so nice and the texture of veggie was soft.
Overall the food were delicious and enjoyable. Service was good, staff were accommodating, atmosphere is nice.

Canton Paradise serves good Chinese food, though it’s on the pricier side. Service was quick, and while not all servers spoke English, everyone was friendly and helpful. We especially loved the deep-fried pork ribs and the crispy fried eggplant with pork floss—both were delicious! We were celebrating my friend’s birthday, and the staff surprised us with adorable piggy buns filled with custard. Overall, a great experience!
The food is very good.  Highly recommend the roasted duck. The fish fin egg fried rice is so special with the achohol flame on it. Smells good！
Good food. One of the few places with dim sum available all day long, including at night! Free parking on the weekends and not too crowded. Makes it a good place for a meal on weekends.
